qas.question: When does the Royal Institute's Guide indicate the first RIBA Board was established?
What school document had to meet the standards of the Board for admittance?
What was necessary for testing in schools applying to the RIBA Board?
What body carried out on-site inspection of member schools of the RIBA Board?
When does the Royal Institute's Guide indicate the last RIBA Board was established?
What school document had no impact on the standards of the Board for admittance?
What was unnecessary for testing in schools applying to the RIBA Board?
What body carried out off-site inspection of member schools of the RIBA Board?

context: The RIBA Guide to its Archive and History (1986) has a section on the "Statutory registration of architects" with a bibliography extending from a draft bill of 1887 to one of 1969. The Guide's section on "Education" records the setting up in <a0_0><b4_0>1904<b4_0/><a0_0/> of the RIBA Board of Architectural Education, and the system by which any school which applied for recognition, whose <a1_0><b5_0>syllabus<b5_0/><a1_0/> was approved by the Board and whose examinations were conducted by <a2_0><b6_0>an approved external examiner<b6_0/><a2_0/>, and whose standard of attainment was guaranteed by periodical inspections by a "<a3_0><b7_0>Visiting Board<b7_0/><a3_0/>" from the BAE, could be placed on the list of "recognized schools" and its successful students could qualify for exemption from RIBA examinations.
